creator: smcardle@spansurf.com
text:
Hi,

I have just downloaded the latest chainsaw from the link on the chainsaw page 
(21-06-2005). 

Configuration:
We have a bunch of HP-UX servers configured with log4j. I have added a section 
to the log4j.properties on the remote servers for a defaultSocketAppender that 
is to be used when logging events for the com.o2.germany logger and the de 
logger.

The current logfile appender (also on both loggers) works just fine. We also 
have a custom datagramAppender that also works fine. However, when I configure 
chainsaw to use a socket receiver listening to port 4444 I get NO events 
propergated to chainsaw at all (only the chainsaw org logger events). N.B. The 
following sample from our log4j.properties file showing the remoteHost as 
demuc10680 is correct. This is the name of my desktop PC that I am trying to 
run chainsaw on.

The version of log4j at the remote servers is 1.2.8

#log4j.properties remote server "vdcca"
log4j.logger.com.o2.germany = DEBUG, logfile, defaultSocketAppender
log4j.logger.de = DEBUG, logfile, defaultSocketAppender
.
.
.
# defaultSocketAppender is set to be a SocketAppender. This is used for Chainsaw
log4j.appender.defaultSocketAppender=org.apache.log4j.net.SocketAppender
log4j.appender.defaultSocketAppender.threshold=DEBUG
log4j.appender.defaultSocketAppender.RemoteHost=demuc10680
log4j.appender.defaultSocketAppender.port=4444
log4j.appender.defaultSocketAppender.locationInfo=true
.
.
.

Any help here would be great as the documentation is sparse and totally 
unhelpfull.

Regards

Steve

creator: sdeboy@iname.com
text:
Location info is currently not supported when using log4j 1.2.x to send events
via SocketAppender to the latest version of Chainsaw.

Change these lines to receive events (minus location info):

remove this line (or change to =false)
log4j.appender.defaultSocketAppender.locationInfo=true

change the order of appenders (in case you're using any location info patterns:
line/file/etc):
log4j.logger.com.o2.germany = DEBUG, defaultSocketAppender, logfile
log4j.logger.de = DEBUG, defaultSocketAppender, logfile

We are going to work on serial-compatibility between 1.2.8 and 1.3 but it's not
yet available.
